page.title: 05Birkenhead Park
page.content:
Birkenhead Park was the first public park in the country. We like it for its open spaces to play in, for its sports areas, for its quiet places to walk in and because it costs nothing. However, some people thought a small entrance fee might keep out the people who destroy things.
{Our park is so big and great {No need to pay-just go through a gate. {There's a gate and rocks to climb {So come-on in-have a good time {There are swings and things {And magnificent trees {Plants and flowers up to your knees {Shades and shades of green on green {The swiftest squirrels you have seen {And with Central Park a mere copy of { this- {We think our park is bliss.
